dk.nesos.view.camera
Class Camera

java.lang.Object
  dk.nesos.view.camera.Camera

public final class Camera
extends Object

Simulates a simple camera in OpenGL.

NOTE: Upwards is defined to be the Vector [0, 1, 0].

Author:
ndhb
See Also:
GLU.gluLookAt(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float)

 void rotateX(float radians)
          Rotating the view around the X-axis can be achieved by multiplying the matrix:
[ 1 0 0 ] R_x(t) = [ 0 cos(t) -sin(t) ] [ 0 sin(t) cos(t) ]
with the direction vector.
 void rotateY(float radians)
          Rotating the view around the Y-axis can be achieved by multiplying the matrix:
[ cos(t) 0 sin(t) ] R_y(t) = [ 0 1 0 ] [ -sin(t) 0 cos(t) ]
with the direction vector.
 void rotateZ(float radians)
          Rotating the view around the Z-axis can be achieved by multiplying the matrix:
[ cos(t) -sin(t) 0 ] R_z(t) = [ sin(t) cos(t) 0 ] [ 0 0 1 ]
with the direction vector.

Constant Field Values

UP

private static final Vector3f UP
The UP vector in the world.

direction

private Vector3f direction

The direction in 3D space of the camera.

The camera is always looking in this direction.

frustums

private Frustum[] frustums

The 6 frustum planes defined by the view.

position

private Vector3f position

The position in 3D space of the camera.

The position of the virtual observer.

axisListName

private int axisListName

Display List name for drawing axis

Constructor Detail

Camera

public Camera()

This constructor quickly sets UP a camera at [1, 20, 1] with direction [1, 0, 0].

That means the camera is located 20 units UP the Y-axis and looking down the X-axis.

Camera

public Camera(Vector3f location,
              Vector3f direction)

This constructor sets UP a camera and its direction at the supplied locations in 3D space.

refresh

public void refresh()

Performs an update of the view.

After modifying the camera position or direction this method should be called to orient the OpenGL Modelview-matrix.

rotateAroundAxis

public void rotateAroundAxis(float radians,
                             Vector3f axis)

Rotates the direction around an arbitrary axis (represented by a vector).

Parameters:
radians - the amount to rotate
axis - the vector representing the axis.

rotateX

public void rotateX(float radians)
Rotating the view around the X-axis can be achieved by multiplying the matrix:
              [ 1       0        0      ] 
   R_x(t) =   [ 0       cos(t)  -sin(t) ]
              [ 0       sin(t)  cos(t)  ]

with the direction vector.

Note. This method unfolds the matrix multiplication to avoid creating unnecessary objects (eg. Matrix3f).

Parameters:
radians - the amount to rotate

rotateY

public void rotateY(float radians)
Rotating the view around the Y-axis can be achieved by multiplying the matrix:
              [ cos(t)  0       sin(t)  ] 
   R_y(t) =   [ 0       1       0       ]
              [ -sin(t) 0       cos(t)  ]

with the direction vector.

Note. This method unfolds the matrix multiplication to avoid creating unnecessary objects (eg. Matrix3f).

Parameters:
radians - the amount to rotate

rotateZ

public void rotateZ(float radians)
Rotating the view around the Z-axis can be achieved by multiplying the matrix:
              [ cos(t)  -sin(t) 0       ] 
   R_z(t) =   [ sin(t)  cos(t)  0       ]
              [ 0       0       1       ]

with the direction vector.

Note. This method unfolds the matrix multiplication to avoid creating unnecessary objects (eg. Matrix3f).

Parameters:
radians - the amount to rotate

setDirection

public void setDirection(Vector3f direction)

Sets the camera looking in the specified direction.

Parameters:
direction - The direction to set.

setPosition

computeFrustums

private void computeFrustums()

Computes the frustum planes based on the current ModelView and Projection matrices.

Copied from Mark Morley's article on OpenGL.org "Frustum Culling in OpenGL"

drawAxis

public void drawAxis()

Draws lines along the axis of the current coordinate system.
